posts.post_content: I can't think of many mill deck types that would want to use this... But it does exist, and it does have the potential to be very powerful. It might be kinda cool as an alternate win-con for self-mill, in case all the wrong cards hit the grave or if [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac) bites it, or something.

Posted By: Totema (9/25/2012 6:42:57 PM)

posts.post_content:
Yes, self mill will work out really well. Though most other decks will frown at this card.  
  
Think of guys like [Undead Alchemist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undead Alchemist), [Skaab Ruinator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skaab Ruinator), [Armored Skaab](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armored Skaab), [Chronic Flooding](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chronic Flooding), things like that. Mill enough of your own cards with flashback and such, while milling their deck with your zombies, then pull this card out for a win right when they don't expect you to be able to mill 20-40 cards at once.
posts.html:
Yes, self mill will work out really well. Though most other decks will frown at this card.

Think of guys like Undead Alchemist, Skaab Ruinator, Armored Skaab, Chronic Flooding, things like that. posts.post_content:
Thinking about putting 2 of this into my standard legal storm deck, it runs 4 epic experiments, 4 increasing vengeance, 4 reverberate and 2 chandra, you use epic experiment for 5, topdeck a reverberate or increasing vengeance to keep it going, and then run 8 burn cards, 4 pillars of flame and 4 izzet charms.  
  
if you add these then you have been through your deck enough times to kill them 3 times or more.
